text: PC Party wins Canadian federal election today in 1979, forming a minority government. Joe Clark becomes Canada's youngest PM at age 39
In 1867, Queen Victoria decreed that Canada's Confederation will officially take place on July 1 of the same year
Gilbert White Ganong born today in 1851 in Springfield, NB. His confection empire continues today
Former senator James Gladstone born today in 1887. He was the first Aboriginal senator, appointed by Prime Minister Diefenbaker in 1958
The first public performance of Alexander Muir's song Maple Leaf Forever. The song symbolizes Canada's heritage and values
The death of George-Etienne Cartier in 1873. A key player in Confederation, he helped to bring French and English Canada together
The Royal Winnipeg Ballet was founded today in 1939. It is Canada‚Äôs oldest ballet company. @RWBallet
Father of Confederation William Henry Steeves born today in 1814 in Hillsborough, New Brunswick
Happy 105th birthday to Canada's national parks! The Dominion Parks Branch, established today in 1911, was first in the world
Happy International Museum Day! Congratulations to the Museums that enrich our communities, help us learn, & preserve & promote our heritage
Today in 1806, lumber baron Philemon Wright sends his first raft down Ottawa River. This event opened a timber industry
In 1603, Samuel de Champlain left France for his first voyage to Canada. He is best known for founding what is today Quebec City
The first Stanley Cup was presented to the Montreal Hockey Club today in 1893.
John Diefenbaker first becomes a PC MP in 1940. He won his seat 13 consecutive times and served as PM
Oil is discovered in Turner Valley, Alberta today in 1914.
In 1906, Adam Beck established the first publicly owned electrical utility in the world - The Hydro-Electric Power Commission of Ontario
The first Winnipeg Music Festival opens in 1919 with 2500 performers. This year, the festival celebrated its 98th birthday
Writer Roch Carrier is born in Sainte-Justine, QC in 1937. Prolific in French, Carrier is well loved in English for ‚ÄúThe Hockey Sweater‚Äù
On the eve of Canada 150 the government continues their #liberalwaronhistory as Confederation Museum is being shut down. #cdnpoli
The #liberalwaronhistory is going according to plan‚ÄîConfederation Museum in PEI is being closed. #cdnpoli
Battle of the Gulf of St. Lawrence begins in 1942. The fight between the Royal Cdn Navy and German U-Boats brings WWII to Canada's shore
Singer/songwriter Andy Kim born in Montreal today in 1946 - "Ain't It Good, Ain't It Right"
In 1944, the Canadian Army tanks see action as part of a major Allied offensive near Rome. Germany would surrender a year later
Mario Lemieux is born in Montreal in 1965. He played 17 seasons with the Pittsburgh Penguins between 1984 and 2006
The capital of the United Province of Canada moved from Kingston to Montreal in 1844. It remained the capital until November 14, 1849

Barbara Ann Scott , the first Canadian to win the figure skating gold medal, was born
in  1928. She was best known as ‚ÄúCanada‚Äôs Sweetheart

Hank Snow born today in 1914. He is best known for writing and singing ‚ÄúI‚Äôve Been
Everywhere, Man‚Äù

Today in 1885, Governor Middleton‚Äôs forces defeat the Metis uprising at Batoche. This
marks the end of the second Riel Rebellion
Steve Nash becomes the first Canadian to win the NBA MVP award today in 2005.
Happy 29th birthday to the Loonie! Canada's first $1 coin was unveiled today in 1987. Today it is a national symbol
Father of Confederation Sir Samuel Leonard Tilley, a New Brunswick Conservative, is born today in 1818
Germany surrenders in WWII - Cdn military is a key part of the Allied victory in Europe. Over 1 million Canadians served and 47,000 died
First Group of Seven exhibition opened today in 1920. Their distinctly Canadian style continues to captivate. #canadianart
1859: Sir John Franklin died today on board HMS Erebus searching for Northwest Passage. The ship's location was a mystery until Sept 2014
Today in 1970, Cdn musicians Burton Cummings, Randy Bachman and the Guess Who top US charts with hit song "American Woman"
Maj Gen Procter and Tecumseh attack Americans at Fort Meigs in 1813. While 400 US soldiers die, the British lose only 15
The 1st Cdn Division relieved at Ypres in 1915. After 2 weeks, 1 in 5 division members sent to the battle were injured, missing or killed
Group of Seven artist Franklin Carmichael was born today in 1890, in Orillia Ontario
Today in 1915, Col. John McCrae wrote "In Flanders Fields". Though he died before the end of the war, his poem symbolizes sacrifices of WWI
Father of Confederation Adams George Archibald was born today in 1814 in Truro, Nova Scotia
Happy #MusicMonday! Music is not just entertainment ‚Äì it helps youth develop important skills and can create lifelong passions for all ages
In 2011, the Conservative Party won a majority government. I am proud of the good work we did for Canada throughout the four year mandate
1844: Elijah McCoy born in Colchester ON. The Cdn son of escaped slaves, his engine lubrication system originated phrase "The Real McCoy‚Äù
Canada's first $5 bill was issued today in 1912. The bill would be equivalent to over $100 today!
Conservative Sir Charles Tupper, a Father of Confederation, becomes Canada's 6th PM today in 1896
Happy Birthday to Canada's 22nd Prime Minister, @stephenharper! He is Canada's 6th longest-serving PM
Canadian Andrew Wiggins was named NBA Rookie of the year in 2015- in a game invented by Canadian James Naismith in 1891
NHL goalie and 2002 Olympic Gold medal team member Curtis Joseph is born in Keswick, ON in 1967
Today in 1903, a rockslide from Turtle Mountain devastates the town off Frank, AB, killing 70 in 100 seconds.
William Hall is born in Horton Bluff, NS in 1827. He would be the first black man and the third Canadian to be awarded the Victoria Cross.
